intro: Trattinnickia burserifolia, commonly known as the Bursera-leaved Trattinnickia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves that resemble those of the genus Bursera. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
